description:
Beauveria bassiana ARSEF 2860 is a strain of the entomopathogenic fungus Beauveria bassiana. Entomopathogenic fungi are microorganisms that can infect and kill insects and other arthropods.

Beauveria bassiana is a ubiquitous fungus found in soils worldwide. The ARSEF 2860 strain was isolated from a dead insect and is maintained in the USDA-ARS Collection of Entomopathogenic Fungal Cultures (ARSEF).

This strain is known to produce a suite of insecticidal compounds, including the cyclic depsipeptide beauvericin, which disrupts cell membranes and induces apoptosis in insect cells. The fungus can infect a wide range of insect pests, including beetles, caterpillars, and flies, through direct contact and subsequent penetration of the insect cuticle.

Ongoing research explores the potential of Beauveria bassiana ARSEF 2860 as a biological control agent against various agricultural and forest pests, as well as its mode of action and interactions with the insect immune system.
